Full commitment text: Develop a list of all datasets including technical specifications and a plan of their progressive publication on the Open Data Portal

Commitment title: 4 Data Standards
Full commitment text: Develop technical and content specifications for public administration data and metadata for the Open Data Portal and guidelines for data publication and further use based on public license

Commitment title: 5 Improved Register of Contracts
Full commitment text: Further develop the Central Register of Contracts reflecting the needs of public users br br Context The setup of the Central Register of Contracts CRC has been the first and foremost step of br br information disclosure in Slovakia The CRC enables citizens to monitor the allocation of state funds br br This is the highest ranked action among experts personalities and non governmental organizations

Commitment title: 6 Continuous Dataset Publising
Full commitment text: 2 Publish pilot datasets on the Open Data Portal in compliance with the approved OGP Action br br Plan of the Slovak Republic br br 6 Publish at least 2 datasets from each ministry during the period of 12 months on the Open br br Data Portal based on the proposed plan of for data publication br br 7 Publish data regarding the allocation of Structural Funds in the scope defined for the ITMS on the Open Data Portal

Commitment title: 7 ITMS Dataset
Full commitment text: 2 Publish pilot datasets on the Open Data Portal in compliance with the approved OGP Action br br Plan of the Slovak Republic br br 6 Publish at least 2 datasets from each ministry during the period of 12 months on the Open br br Data Portal based on the proposed plan of for data publication br br 7 Publish data regarding the allocation of Structural Funds in the scope defined for the ITMS on the Open Data Portal

Commitment title: 8 EU Funds and Subsidies Monitoring
Full commitment text: Publish data regarding the allocation of EEA Financial Mechanism Norwegian Financial br br Mechanism Swiss Financial Mechanism and other Ministry grant schemes on the Open Data br br Portal in the scope defined by the Central Register of Projects

Commitment title: 9 EU Funds and Subsidies Monitoring
Full commitment text: Prepare a tender for the public procurement of the web application for the allocation of br br Structural Funds EEA Financial Mechanism Norwegian Financial Mechanism Swiss Financial br br Mechanism and other Ministry grant schemes

Commitment title: 1 Develop and implement an Accountability Consequences Management Framework for public servants
Full commitment text: Develop and implement an accountability consequences management framework for public servants Accountability will be enhanced in that this framework will concretise Batho Pele People First principles and ensure that public servants are held accountable to the public and the communities they serve

Commitment title: 2 Service Delivery Improvement Forums SDIFs
Full commitment text: The focus on this commitment is to implement and formalise partnerships with civil society organisations in all nine provinces to establish Service Delivery Improvement Forums SDIFs and to provide timely citizen report cards on service delivery Our focus going forward would be to establish functional SDIFs in the period new financial year based on the concept document and consultations with provinces Part of the effort is to galvanize civil society organisations and partner with them in forging these forums

Commitment title: 3 Mainstream Citizen Participation in the Public Sector
Full commitment text: Focus on mainstreaming citizen participation in the public sector Inter alia ensure that every public sector department across all spheres has a functional resourced and well capacitated citizen engagement unit which regularly and proactively engages with civil society br br In terms of the IRM report whilst this was fully implemented there is a need to stretch the commitment now The focus should now be on implementation and making the systems and process functional br br The DPSA is working with nine government departments three per quarter in the period 1 April 2013 to 31 March 2014 with the aim of institutionalising public participation in these departments In collaboration with the Public Administration Leadership and Management Academy PALAMA the DPSA will provide training for officials in all departments to build internal capacity to successfully implement and sustain Public Participation activities in their respective departments

Commitment title: 4 Develop an integrated and publicly accessible portal of environmental management information
Full commitment text: This commitment has been modified and carried over in line with the stretch and ambition approach While in the previous plan we focused on conducting a feasibility study now the focus is on developing the actual portal and integrating all existing portals and information br br Currently government has portals across different government departments on environmental information A need has been identified to have an integrated portal that provides aggregated environmental information across sectors The availability of such a portal would strengthen compliance with environmental regulation while at the same time providing citizens with access to comprehensive information on environment

Commitment title: 5 Development of an on line crowdsourcing tool that will allow the public to submit data on protected areas and conservation areas
Full commitment text: Crowdsourcing is becoming a popular way to collaborate on projects This portal will enable volunteers general public to submit information on protected areas and conservation areas to the department and by so doing that will enable the department to improve its data on the conservation estate The portal will go live early 2014 High level outcomes are Improved public access to information on the conservation estate in South Africa Improved quality of data on the conservation estate in South Africa and citizen participation

Commitment title: 6 Schools Connectivity
Full commitment text: Government has realised that access to education provides for children at a young age to be moulded into our future leaders and technocrats for the country The Department of Communications embraces this thought br br in ensuring that internet connectivity br br access hardware and content is an imminent requirement to bridging the digital divide and streamlining learning in the country br br The Department has embarked on a schools connectivity rollout project with telecoms operators as a start to ensure that we bring technology to learners This will be done in br br 2 phases whereby phase 1 will entail the connectivity to 1650 schools by savings achieved in the 2010 World Cup and phase 2 will be rolled out by telecoms operators under their Universal Service Obligations USO br br Phase 1 br br Financial savings has been achieved in the br br 2010 World Cup by Telkom The Department br br has requested that Telkom provide a model whereby schools will be connected with the financial savings derived As such the initial plan was to provide only internet connectivity to schools however the department realised that a turnkey solution would benefit the schools and learners better than just internet connectivity Department of Basic Education DBE then derived a hardware specification for the model which is to be implemented br br This then would ensure that schools would receive internet connectivity and hardware computers in the 1650 schools identified Further to this DBE will be developing an internet portal for education thus allowing learners and teachers to access educational content br br Any solution is never complete without ICT training hence the department intends to provide free ICT training to teachers thus empowering them to be able to use the technology provided and also pass on this knowledge to learners This rollout is intended to start in the current financial year and will span for 2years thereafter br br Phase 2 br br In order for telecoms operators to be given a license community obligations regarded as Universal Service Obligations USO were imposed on them to fulfil One such obligation is providing connectivity to schools Each operator was allocated a number of schools to connect which ICASA had to allocate and manage br br Providing connectivity without hardware computers is futile hence ICASA will be in the process of amending certain obligations to include a full solution to each school that an operator connects Once this process is completed the operators will provide a rollout plan which will be managed by ICASA and monitored by the Department of Communications Department of Basic Education

Commitment title: 7 Implement a Know Your Service Rights and Responsibilities Campaign
Full commitment text: The purpose of this commitment was is to enhance the capacity and capabilities of communities to access and claim their socio economic rights through the roll out of national public education campaigns specifically a public outreach campaign on Know Your Service Rights and Responsibilities KYSR R to inform citizens about their service rights responsibilities and legal mechanisms available to hold government accountable br br More work that focuses on educating citizens on their responsibilities to the state needs to be undertaken

Commitment title: 1 Accountability Consequences Management Framework
Full commitment text: Develop and implement an accountability consequences management framework for public servants br br Accountability will be enhanced in that this framework will concretise Batho Pele People First principles and ensure that public servants are held accountable to the public and the communities they serve

Commitment title: 2 Service Delivery Improvement Forums
Full commitment text: Formalise partnerships with civil society organisations in all nine provinces to establish Service Delivery Improvement Forums SDIFs at local level to provide timely citizen report cards on service delivery levels at community level especially in relation to primary health care water sanitation environmental management and housing br br Accountability to the public regarding service delivery performance will be enhanced as well as greater citizen engagement in service delivery performance monitoring

Commitment title: 3 Know Your Service Rights and Responsibilities
Full commitment text: Enhance the capacity and capabilities of communities to access and claim their socio economic rights through the roll out of national public education campaigns specifically a public outreach campaign on Know Your Service Rights and Responsibilities KYSR R to inform citizens about their service rights responsibilities and legal mechanisms available to hold government accountable br br Citizen awareness of legal frameworks for accountability transparency and citizen engagement will be enhanced

Commitment title: 4 National Anti Corruption Forum and Anti Corruption Hotline
Full commitment text: Enhance national integrity through institutional capacity building of National Anti Corruption Forum NACF and Anti Corruption Hotline This will include the capacity development of anti corruption officials and strengthening the Hotline s advocacy and investigation functions br br Capacitating the anti corruption mechanisms will enhance accountability and public trust

Commitment title: 5 Guidelines for Corruption Related Sanctions
Full commitment text: Approve guidelines on sanctions for corruption related cases br br Transparency will be enhanced in that the public will know the sanctions for corruption related cases

Commitment title: 6 Develop a Citizen Participation Guideline
Full commitment text: Develop a citizen participation guideline for public sector departments that ensures that every public sector department across all spheres has a functional resourced and capacitated citizen engagement unit which regularly and proactively engages with civil society br br This guideline will give direction to public service departments on citizen engagement in service delivery and policy making through among others the use of online and mobile technology Participatory democracy will be enhanced

Commitment title: 7 Enhance Involvement of Civil Society in the Budget Process
Full commitment text: Enhance the involvement of civil society at every stage of the budgetary process across all spheres of government to enhance the progressive realisation of socioeconomic rights and enable citizens to track public expenditure br br Enable citizens to plan and inform the strategic priorities of the budget thereby ensuring transparency accountability and citizen engagement at every stage of the process

Commitment title: 8 Environmental Management Portal Feasibility Study
Full commitment text: Explore the feasibility of establishing a single agency mandated by Government to develop a comprehensive and publicly accessible portal of environmental management information br br Transparency will be enhanced if citizens have access to reliable environmental data on water quality and other environmental issues

Commitment title: A Strengthening Public Private Collaboration
Full commitment text: Various chanels both online and of line are planed to be used to communicate with a wide range of stakeholders and tap into the colective inteligence Ofline chanels include expert group metings and citzens jury online chanels include social networking services web discusions on policies and mobile aplications In aditon the Korean government wil present exemplary cases of the private public colaboration to government agencies at diferent levels and continue to provide an online discusion platform on the e People websites of local governments throughout the country in earnest until 2015 Given that he private public colaboration is not he result of policy making but part of policy making proces that engages public participation the Korean government wil focus on engaging a wider range of stakeholders in discusions and sharing best practices with various government agencies rather than seting out quantiative targets In pursuing such a policy the government wil arange a schedule for online debates for major projects and any citzen or civic group is encouraged to participate in those online policy debates

Commitment title: B Providing Customized Services
Full commitment text: In order to provide customized services that adres diferent public neds the Korean government has divided public services with a high demand into four groups general services public safety etc target group specific services for mothers newborn babies elementary secondary schol students colege students job sekers and the elderly services for vulnerable groups people with disabilties rural residents and other underprivileged people and busines specific services for smal busineses SMEs and other general busineses In 2014 the Korean government wil select 50 flagship service projects for the central and local governments based on private sector expert groups opinions and promote them in earnest In doing so in order to ensure transparency and acountabilty through public participation an advisory commite a national survey and the private public task force for public service design wil help make sure that hose selected service projects are in line with the public s demand In 2015 those flagship projects wil be adjusted and further developed to adres the public neds Also by holding multiple consultations and workshops intended for civil communites and citzens the Korean government wil reach out o people in ned and wil come up with new public services that they need

Commitment title: C Enhancing Information Disclosure
Full commitment text: Since late March in 2014 any government documents signed by director generals or higher have ben disclosed no mater whether they are requested to be disclosed or not Those documents are uploaded on information disclosure portal open go kr However in acordance with the Public Information Act documents that contain private information 8 items must not be disclosed At he end of May about 80 00 original documents were disclosed and the range of documents to be disclosed wil be expanded from 2015 To be specific even those documents signed by directors wil be disclosed which wil result in 10 milion documents to be disclosed anualy In order to make sure the shared information met the demands of civil society the Ministry of Security and Public Administration MOSPA wil form a citzen watch group that overses the proces of information disclosure by the end of June 2014 and the watch group is composed of civil society members experts and other ordinary br br citzens The watch group members were selected through an online contest among those who were interested in disclosure of information and those who had most actively requested for disclosure of information became the members of the group This group wil be responsible for reviewing how disclosure of information is conducted in the central government agencies as wel as local governments and monitoring the performance of each agency by requesting disclosure of information br br themselves Another goal to be met in 2014 is to improve the quality of disclosed information To br br do so the Korean government wil anounce in advance the list of to be disclosed information categorized under ten specific areas of high interest health welfare food safety child rearing finance education consumer protection leisure job and housing

Commitment title: D Strengthening Public Service Ethics
Full commitment text: In order to discourage retired public oficials from seking lucrative positons outside the public sector post public employment wil be more strictly inspected in 2014 with a target restriction rate of 9 7 percent A detailed plan to strengthen the inspection is scheduled to be made available within the month of April 2014 The Korean government wil hold regular advisory group metings at least twice a year withretired oficials public administration profesors and experts to gain fedback constantly on the inspection proces in place The target restriction rate wil be adjusted upward every year from 2015 Also retired public oficials wil be provided with guidelines about post public employment restrictions on the website for aset disclosure as son as they sign in to declare their retirement status In aditon from the second half of 2014 the result of inspections on post public employment wil beposted on the websites of government oficial ethics commites for the purpose of making the ethics commites more transparent and acountable and enhancing their reliabilty to citzens br br

Commitment title: E Encouraging the Private Sector to Utilze Public Data
Full commitment text: At the second Open Data Strategy Council held in April 2014 and composed of enterprises civilian experts etc the Execution Plan for the Provision and Promotion of Public Data was passed According to the plan 504 types of key public data identified through agency assessment and public feedback notably via consultative advisory bodies and user communities which most central and local government organizations have with examples such as Open Data Partnership of the Gyeonggi Provincial Government and open data user community of the Ministry of Education which are expected to have high demands and relatively a bigger impact on the society will be selected and disclosed first Not only that a private public consultative body whose members include the companies that use public data for their business will be operated in order to get feedback from the private sector and reflect their views on data sharing policies br br In this regard the Grand Open Forum for Public Data was held in May 2014 along with about 400 experts from the private and public sectors At the Forum a private public data sharing task force team for each of the 16 strategic areas will be officially launched The 16 task force teams are expected to act as communication channels between the government and civil society The task force teams are headed by chief open data officers of government agencies involved who are responsible for releasing open data and nurturing companies that use open data in collaboration with the Open Data Ecosystem Group The task force teams are coordinated by the MOSPA the lead ministry on open data and they are expected to hold meetings periodically e g bi monthly and conferences at least once a year in an effort to analyze demanded data from the private sector and to consider the private sector s opinions br br In addition the Korean government will continue to work on evolving the best practices of the use of public data among private enterprises such as Naver Naver Map Daum Daum Maps SK Planet security cameras public transportation information etc and Solideo Systems building information in a hope that more and more companies will utilize public data for their businesses

Commitment title: 1 1 1 Use e People to promote public input in policy development
Full commitment text: In terms of improving public services public service itself first needs to be defined and we should identify the areas for improvement and needs of citizens In this context the Korean Government plans to provide wider opportunities for greater citizen engagement and expand communication channels to reflect their needs and creative ideas in the decision making process

Full commitment text: President Lee Myung bak believes that Policy consumers have the solutions to challenges we face in policy implementations Emphasizing the government efforts in incorporating public opinions by listening to what citizens say about various policies and strategies central government ministries plan to conduct Field Administration for the provision of quality administrative services to meet their expectations

Full commitment text: More government information will be available publicly by disclosing critical information in advance for the daily life of the public The information for advanced disclosure will be about food environment education and other areas Prior to the disclosure engaging with civil organizations and monitoring groups will enable relevant information to be opened Provision of information from citizens perspectives and communication between the government and civil society will also be reinforced and the information will also be available via mobile devices

Commitment title: 2 2 1 Strengthen asset disclosure for public servants
Full commitment text: To reduce corruption asset disclosure for public servants will be strengthened to ensure more transparency in the civil service Restrictions on post public employment will also be strictly monitored to further promote the culture of civil service integrity

Full commitment text: To reduce corruption asset disclosure for public servants will be strengthened to ensure more transparency in the civil service Restrictions on post public employment will also be strictly monitored to further promote the culture of civil service integrity

Full commitment text: We will also enhance the one stop budget waste portal by not only integrating services on budget waste of central government ministries but also those of metropolitan and local governments

Commitment title: Commitment No 10 Increased participation of sector stakeholders in defining the br br goals of the National Maritime Rescue Plans
Full commitment text: The National Maritime Rescue Plan PNS is the framework document establishing the priorities and strategic lines of action for the duration set forth therein of the Ministry of Infrastructure s policy on maritime rescue and combating pollution Even though there is a period for consultations these consultations are on a text that has already been drafted internally and which may include only partially or even ignore certain aspects that may be relevant for the maritime sector br br The aim is to have meetings before producing the draft the amendments or the new versions of the PNS with the participation of the stakeholders These meetings should enable the incorporation into the PNS at an early stage of elements that may be relevant from a perspective other than that of the public administration and which given their nature or as a result of the public administration s internal perspective may not be currently given the attention they deserve This measure will be carried out through the constitution of a working group to monitor participation in the design of the PNS as well as through conferences and working meetings with the stakeholders of the maritime sector

Commitment title: Commitment No 9 Creation of the Spanish Council on Drug Dependence
Full commitment text: Creation of a participatory council for defining policies on drug dependence and other addictions br br 1 The creation of the Spanish Council on Drug Dependence is a measure to rationalise and reorganise the collegiate bodies under the Government Delegation for the National Plan on Drugs It will enable the reduction in the number of said bodies while at the same time increasing participation in the definition of drug policies by sectors that had never been represented in any such bodies thus complying with UN and EU recommendations to promote citizen participation br br 2 Its creation will take place during the parliamentary procedure for enacting the Public Sector Reform Act and at the same time the Inter ministerial Group for the National Plan on Drugs and the Advisory Council of the Spanish Observatory on Drugs and Drug Addictions will disappear br br 3 Once the aforementioned Act is approved the composition of said State Council will be stipulated through implementing regulations namely in a Royal Decree br br 4 The current plan is for the Royal Decree stipulating the aspects regarding the State Council to incorporate four permanent working groups and a plenary with the following level of representation br br Working groups In all of them there will be at least one official from the Government Delegation for the National Plan on Drugs and there can be other members from the Plenary inter ministerial in nature if they so request br br a Health Commission made up of experts from Medical Scientific Societies renowned in the field of addictions br br b Social Commission made up of experts in social science renowned in the field of addictions not previously represented in the bodies that are to disappear br br c Third Sector Commission made up of representatives from Third Sector Social Action entities not previously represented in the bodies that are to disappear br br d Labour Environment Commission made up of representatives of the employers associations and the trade unions it already exists and is part of the State Council br br The Chairs of these Commissions shall be part of the Plenary which with representatives from other ministerial bodies will be created within the Council

Commitment title: Commitment No 8 Greater control and transparency in public grants
Full commitment text: The legal framework of grants will be will be extended to all the assistance granted in the public administrative sector and all monetary disbursements for no consideration will have the status of grants and therefore will have to comply with legal provisions Moreover progress will be made in the coordination model among the different public administrations In addition greater equality and transparency will be fostered in the awarding of grants by promoting the competitive procedure and restricting any other awarding models In this regard the law sets forth the open call method and allows procedures of continued submission of applications br br To develop the principle of transparency and following the forecasts of the CORA the functionality of the National Database on Grants BDNS will be strengthened and its use will be promoted as a planning instrument and for combating grant related fraud but also part of its content which will be given public status will be used to make the BDNS work as a national centralised system for advertising grants empowering the General State Administration Comptroller br br General s Office to advertise all the current calls as well as the awarding resolutions throughout the national territory Measures will also be adopted to streamline and make more flexible the processing of grants by the interested parties as regards the submission of certificates and other administrative documents the amendments to the awarding resolution occurred during the implementation of the grant or regarding the deadline and the system for justifying expenses in the corresponding phase Particularly noteworthy is the introduction of the streamlined system for determining costs based on national experience and incorporating the new EU streamlining methods envisaged for the 2014 2020 Framework

Commitment title: Commitment No 7 Portal of the Administration of Justice
Full commitment text: Opening up the information of Public Administrations is not only a trend but rather an obligation that is being increasingly taken on both by citizens and by the Public Administrations that are in charge of providing it In this regard the Portal of the Administration of Justice PAJ constitutes an appropriate platform to promote access to the information and services of the Administration of Justice by citizens and by judicial professionals br br The objective of this commitment is to promote access to information through the PAJ in the following areas br br Promote the Portal of the Administration of Justice as a repository of the Administration of Justice for the Ministry of Justice the Autonomous Communities that have powers in the area of Justice the General Council of the Judiciary and the General State Prosecution Service in the area of the State Technical Committee of the Administration of Justice CTEAJE Thus the PAJ seeks to be the portal for all judicial operators with responsibilities in the area of Justice therefore the CTEAJE will study the necessary amendments to enable it to adapt in order to concentrate all the information that is useful for these groups of users br br Incorporation of new services promoting transparency especially through the creation of this Portal s website which will include the following services access to electronic auctions advertisements for auctions access to information for victims information on proceedings and on procedural formalities and access to the Administration of Justice s Single Official Bulletin Board aligned with the General State Administration s Single Official Bulletin Board which is managed in the framework of the CORA br br Legislative process of the following legislative instruments Ministerial Order on the establishment of the website Ministerial Order on electronic registry and Ministerial Order on the Official Bulletin Board br br Access to the European e Justice Portal which will host the actions on open government and open data included in the e Justice Action Plan 2014 2018 that is currently under negotiation br br Creation of an open data section which may be used to disseminate data relating to the Administration of Justice This action will be aligned with the national open data strategy and will be carried out in collaboration with datos gob es a national portal that organises and manages the Catalogue of Public Information of the Public Sector

Commitment title: Commitment No 3 Open education resources
Full commitment text: The initiative is part of compliance with UNESCO s 2012 Paris Declaration on Open Educational Resources Furthermore the European Commission initiative Opening UP Education has among its objectives two which are directly related on the one hand promoting the shared used of open educational resources and on the other increasing their use thus guaranteeing that the materials produced with public funding are accessible to all For its part the Ministry of Education Culture and Sport MECD s Digital Culture at School Plan includes five priority working areas in collaboration with Spain s Autonomous Communities and one of them is to develop a common space for open educational resources br br One of the MECD measures in this framework is the development of the Procomu n open educational resources space enhancing the current platform Agrega by making it more user friendly and incorporating a social network rationale for the purpose of increasing the educational community s participation In this space all of the resources created by the educational administrators will be accessible also making it possible for teacher and the entire educational community to incorporate their own content The second measure is the development and launching of two massive online open courses MOOC for educators Personal learning environments and Project based learning Moreover there is a planned development and launching of a MOOC for families and several about basic skills for educators

Commitment title: Commitment No 2 Improvement of access to and quality of the information of the Spanish Archives Portal PARES http pares mcu es
Full commitment text: The PARES Portal is a project aimed at disseminating Spain s historical document heritage held in its network of centres via the internet and offering free access to researchers and the general public interested in accessing the Spanish Archives document holdings through digitised images In this area actions are being carried out to address different issues Firstly adapting to the European and other international technical directives regarding the interoperability of archive information systems Secondly reengineering the archival description process to improve integration among archive databases and improve online information access Thirdly adapting archival description of recent contemporary archive holdings to the requirements of the data protection regulations br br Furthermore integrated electronic tools are incorporated for managing State archives public services including measures to incorporate archival information services into the latest generation of social networks Lastly the portal features multilingual automatic search strategies in Spanish and Spain s co official languages English and French

Commitment title: Commitment No 1 Transparency Portal
Full commitment text: Among the most noteworthy provisions of Spain s Act on Transparency Access to Public Information and Good Governance which was passed in November 2013 is the creation of a Transparency Portal br br This Portal will give the public access to information on the General State Administration and its agencies and departments Through this central point of access the public will be able to obtain information on the organisation and functions of public bodies new legislation going through the parliamentary process the criteria used to interpret legal provisions applicable to Administration citizen relationships and detailed information on the use of public funds contracts grants salaries etc br br On this point the Government aims to provide a full response to requests for information submitted by citizens and meet its goal of publishing a large amount of information that is presented and processed from an IT perspective based on a set of common rules br br The Transparency Portal will also give citizens a tool for requesting information electronically tracking the status of their requests and obtaining a timely and suitable response Finally pursuant to the Act on Transparency the Portal will contain not only the information referred to in the Act itself but also the information most frequently requested by citizens exercising their right to access public information

Commitment title: Commitment No 6 Programmes on opening up information and its re use in the public sector
Full commitment text: Promoting the opening up of information and its subsequent re use is an area where it is necessary to strengthen ongoing activities because the effective opening up of data requires training dissemination of best practices availability of support instruments and full coordination between the entities producing information and those re using it These actions are taking place within the Aporta project the national initiative to promote policies for re using public sector information in Spain a project that was awarded the 2013 European Prize for Innovation This programme s measures are part of the Digital Agenda for Spain br br The programme on opening up information and its re use in the public sector includes the following measures I Promotion of the culture of openness and re use of information in the public sector II Consolidation and evolution of the national public sector information catalogue www datos gob es III Advisory and support actions for public entities regarding openness of information IV Actions involving analysis monitoring reporting and dissemination These measures form part of Line III of the Plan to Promote the Digital Economy and Digital Content one of operational plans for the development of the Digital Agenda for Spain Details on the objectives actions and schedule of each measure can be found in said plan 1 Moreover EU Directive 37 2013 revising the legal framework on the re use of public sector information will be transposed to Spain s legal framework

Commitment title: Commitment No 5 Access to and re use of geographic information
Full commitment text: Currently Spain s Public Administrations are required to provide access to the geographic information they generate via standardised interoperable online services that are integrated into the Geographic Data Infrastructure Through the website www ign es and interoperable online geographic data services accessible via geoportals and client apps access is provided to almost all of the data produced by Spain s National Geographic Institute which may be downloaded from the website http centrodedescargas cnig es CentroDescargas br br In addition to emphasising the standardisation of geographic information and the interoperable services based on it the National Centre for Geographic Information will optimise and promote access to the data and services that it provides especially by facilitating public private partnerships and the creation of a chain of web based value added services involving the business and professional sector targeting specific groups of users There are already specific examples of this in the area of planning travel tourism and sporting br br itineraries

Commitment title: Commitment No 4 Accessibility of National Health System microdata
Full commitment text: The Health Information System involves an effort to compile data proceeding from the Health Services of Spain s 17 Autonomous Communities the Ministry of Health s own system and from other sources whether national or international This means that merely compiling this data with logical and structured storage generates added value in and of itself given that none of these bodies could collect Main Objective this data alone thus creating a database that has great potential to be truly useful The goal is to make available to the public the entire NHS database where complete microdata on major statistics could be downloaded for free Moreover this database will be expanded as new information systems are developed Characteristics of the service the NHS database is accessible from the website of Spain s Ministry of Health Social Services and Equality http www msssi gob es estadEstudios estadisticas bancoDatos htm Files may be downloaded for free br br The data provided is anonymised in those operations subject to statistical secrecy because they form part of the National Statistics Plan and include information necessary for their comprehension and use term glossaries questionnaires and fact sheets br br Data directory Files are classified in two categories br br 1 Open access to anonymised microdata files br br Health Barometer The series of anonymised microdata and the necessary documents for understanding them cover 1996 2012 with a gap in 2001 since the opinion survey was not carried out that year The Health Barometer is a statistical operation included in the 2013 2016 National Statistics Plan PEN and previous plans subject to statistical secrecy According to the dissemination calendar for the 2014 Annual Programme the 2013 Health Barometer data is scheduled to be disseminated no later than 30 June of 2014 Once these results are published then the br br microdata from the NHS databank will be included br br National Hospital Catalogue CNH The series of microdata and documents necessary for understanding it covers 1995 2012 The 2013 data in a database format is available on the webpage of the Ministry of Health Social Services and Equality Its inclusion in the br br database is pending br br http www msssi gob es ciudadanos prestaciones cen br br trosServiciosSNS hospitales home htm br br Catalogue of NHS Primary Care Centres The microdata series and documents necessary for understanding it covers 2007 2013 The Catalogue forms part of the Primary Care Information System SIAP br br The European Health Survey in Spain Only one edition was provided in 2009 Statistical operation included in the PEN 2009 2012 subject to statistical secrecy and carried out in collaboration with the National Statistics Institute INE The survey is carried out every five years the field work is being conducted in 2014 br br Spain s National Health Survey ENSE Statistical operation included in PEN 2009 2012 and previous plans The microdata corresponds to the eight editions of the ENSE covering 1987 2011 The first five surveys were conducted in collaboration with Spain s national Sociological Research Centre CIS which carried out the field work thereafter they were carried out in collaboration with the INE br br Inpatient Healthcare Establishments Statistics ESCRI This database covers microdata from 1996 when these statistics became the responsibility of the Ministry of Health and Consumer Affairs to 2009 Statistical operation included in subsequent PEN of the General State Administration br br Statistics on Specialised Healthcare Centres ESCRI has been incorporated into the Statistics on Specialised Healthcare Centres The new Statistics on Specialised Healthcare Centres resulting from the reform of the previous ESCRI compiles data on installations staffing activity and financial data since the 2010 tax year The statistical data for 2010 2012 are available on the NHS interactive consultations page br br http pestadistico inteligenciadegestion msssi es br br Microdata for 2010 2012 is in the process of being anonymised and the accompanying documents are being prepared with plans to upload them to the NHS Database during the second half of 2014 br br 2 Application for access and data mining br br National Death Index IND The available files cover 1987 2014 May of 2014 These data may only be ceded to public or private healthcare centres public health administrations and public research centres Application forms must be sent to the Secretariat of the IND Technical Monitoring Committee Deputy Directorate General for Health Information and Innovation br br Minimum Basic Data Set MBDS for Hospital Admissions and Specialised Outpatient Care Statistical operation included in the 2013 2016 PEN and in previous plans The microdata available in the Database contains information on hospitalisations for 1997 2010 and 2004 2010 for outpatient care Customised data mining is possible by request with a confidentiality commitment The forms and the confidentiality commitment must be sent to the Health Information and Statistics Area of the Deputy Directorate General for Health Information and Innovation The statistical data for the period until 2012 are available on the NHS interactive consultations webpage http pestadistico inteligenciadegestion msssi es

Commitment title: 10 Sistema RED
Full commitment text: Con la universalizaci n del sistema RED se busca simplificar los tr mites a realizar por los ciudadanos con la Seguridad Social a trav s de la centralizaci n de la gesti n mediante un nico sistema que permita la disminuci n de los desplazamientos la reducci n en el uso de documentos en soporte papel o la posibilidad de realizar los tr mites y la presentaci n sin l mite de horarios a trav s de internet El objetivo es la generalizaci n de su uso y la total implantaci n para todos los reg menes del sistema de Seguridad Social La universalizaci n del sistema RED precisa al menos de dos a os para extender su campo de aplicaci n a los colectivos que a n no se han incorporado al mismo

Commitment title: 11 Simplificaci n de los procedimientos de evaluaci n ambiental

Full commitment text: Entendemos que ninguna idea empresarial puede quedar varada por la existencia de barreras burocr ticas Por ello el Gobierno tiene intenci n de favorecer la creaci n de empresas en un plazo breve 24 horas para lo que se potenciar la red de centros de asesoramiento de emprendedores y peque as y medianas empresas y se simplificar n los requisitos administrativos que actualmente se exigen Todo ello formar parte de la Ley de apoyo a los emprendedores que ser aprobada durante el a o 2012 y que adem s facilitar la puesta en marcha de nuevas ideas empresariales y la creaci n de puestos de trabajo a trav s de est mulos fiscales

Commitment title: 13 Reducci n de cargas administrativas para ganaderos y agricultores
Full commitment text: El objetivo es la agilizaci n del proceso de solicitud de tramitaci n de las ayudas directas de la Pol tica Agr cola Com n unificando en todas las comunidades aut nomas las aplicaciones de captura y gesti n de las solicitudes de ayudas directas Ello permitir una simplificaci n de los procedimientos la tramitaci n de las solicitudes ser m s transparente se dar acceso a los beneficiarios a conocer el estado de tramitaci n de sus expedientes y adem s se ahorrar n sensiblemente los costes para la administraci n pues se evitar la realizaci n de diecisiete desarrollos inform ticos distintos Su adopci n se estima en unos ocho meses

Commitment title: 1 Ley de Transparencia Acceso a la Informaci n P blica y Buen Gobierno
Full commitment text: El Gobierno acaba de aprobar el Anteproyecto de Ley de Transparencia Acceso a la Informaci n P blica y Buen Gobierno La Ley tiene un triple alcance

Commitment title: 2 Transparencia y rendici n de cuentas en la Ayuda Oficial al Desarrollo
Full commitment text: El Gobierno de Espa a considera que la transparencia y la rendici n de cuentas de la ayuda al desarrollo deben convertirse en uno de los pilares de la pol tica de cooperaci n espa ola por lo que nuestro compromiso se dirige a establecer un sistema que garantice plenamente la transparencia en la financiaci n y las actuaciones de la Cooperaci n espa ola La implementaci n del sistema se har de manera progresiva dise ando metas que permitan con el tiempo ir ampliando su alcance y calidad

Commitment title: 3 Ley de Estabilidad Presupuestaria y Sostenibilidad Financiera
Full commitment text: Esta Ley da cumplimiento al mandato recogido en el art culo 135 de la Constituci n espa ola y va a constituir la base jur dica y econ mica de la pol tica presupuestaria de todas las Administraciones Espa a se convierte as en uno de los pa ses pioneros en incorporar en un texto de m ximo rango legal las normas de disciplina presupuestaria de la Uni n Europea

Commitment title: 4 Reforma a la Ley de Subvenciones
Full commitment text: El procedimiento de concesi n de subvenciones p blicas ha de responder a criterios concretos previstos en una convocatoria bajo los principios de publicidad transparencia concurrencia competitiva objetividad igualdad y no discriminaci n complementados por la necesaria eficacia en el cumplimiento de los objetivos fijados y eficiencia en la utilizaci n de los recursos p blicos La existencia de subvenciones nominativas ha facilitado un uso abusivo de las mismas para escapar de los principios que han de regir su concesi n Entendemos que los fondos p blicos deben usarse de forma razonable por lo que durante el ejercicio 2013 se modificar la legislaci n en materia de subvenciones para eliminarlas con car cter general de tal forma que se incremente la transparencia en su otorgamiento ejecuci n y evaluaci n de su impacto y se definan criterios homog neos para su concesi n

Commitment title: 5 e justicia
Full commitment text: El Gobierno crear una Agencia espec ficamente dedicada al intercambio de informaci n entre las Administraciones competentes en materia de justicia que facilite su interoperabilidad a trav s de un sistema inform tico que permita el conocimiento inmediato en red de los datos judiciales y de los que constan en los registros p blicos relacionados con la Administraci n de Justicia Esta Agencia tendr como objetivo colaborar con la nueva Agencia Europea de gesti n de los sistemas de informaci n en materia de libertad seguridad y justicia y el mantenimiento de la seguridad de la informaci n judicial

Commitment title: 6 Impulso de las redes sociales para facilitar la participaci n ciudadana
Full commitment text: Durante el a o 2012 se desarrollar n proyectos inform ticos para permitir la interacci n ciudadana a trav s de redes sociales medios telem ticos y aplicaciones espec ficas de telefon a m vil y se actualizar n los consejos locales de seguridad como medio de canalizaci n de las relaciones entre las fuerzas de seguridad y la sociedad

Commitment title: 7 Publicaci n de datos estad sticos sobre criminalidad
Full commitment text: A partir del pr ximo mes de abril los ciudadanos tendr n a su disposici n los datos estad sticos de criminalidad que ser n publicados al menos con car cter trimestral Estos datos se referir n a la media de los ltimos 12 meses por cada tipo de delito y por cada provincia y ciudad aut noma de Espa a Las estad sticas incorporar n adem s los datos procedentes de las polic as auton micas que deber n compatibilizarse con los est ndares del Sistema estad stico de Criminalidad del Ministerio del Interior

Commitment title: 8 Revisi n y simplificaci n normativa
Full commitment text: La Ley de Transparencia Acceso a la Informaci n P blica y Buen Gobierno incluye la obligaci n de todas las Administraciones P blicas de realizar un ejercicio de revisi n simplificaci n y consolidaci n normativa Con ello se pretende eliminar del ordenamiento las normas que han quedado obsoletas y refundir las que se encuentren dispersas Con esta medida se refuerza la seguridad jur dica en la relaci n de los ciudadanos con la Administraci n

Commitment title: 9 e salud
Full commitment text: En diciembre de 2012 se pondr en marcha la primera fase de la plataforma tecnol gica que garantizar la interoperabilidad de la Historia Cl nica Digital El objetivo es que los pacientes puedan ser atendidos con la misma facilidad y rapidez independientemente del lugar de Espa a donde puedan requerir asistencia sanitaria y eliminando trabas burocr ticas a la vez que se dota de una mayor seguridad y rapidez a la atenci n que reciban los pacientes

Commitment title: Commitment 5 Increased aid transparency at global level
Full commitment text: The commitment on increased aid transparency at global level aims to accelerate international efforts on publishing aid information in accordance with the Busan commitment on a Common Standard Increased publication of timely forward looking and comprehensive aid data in a standardised way creates better conditions for accountability and governance in partner countries leading to sustainable and locally owned development results It also facilitates division of labour and the use of all the available financial resources for poverty eradication The commitment will mainly be achieved through activities including those listed here in order to promote other development actors efforts to meet international transparency commitments br br Main activities br br Promote IATI reporting among other development actors and the use of IATI data at country level through dialogue and development of methodology and capacity 9 br br Promote transparency and anti corruption work in the EU and multilateral development organisations including IATI reporting br br Support initiatives related to ICT that facilitate aid transparency br br Promote transparency including budget transparency in partner countries as a part of Swedish development cooperation

Commitment title: Commitment 4 Improved opportunities for dialogue and transparency in aid management and implementation
Full commitment text: The commitment on improved opportunities for dialogue and transparency in aid management and implementation aims to increase mutual knowledge and participation Greater knowledge and involvement of more actors create better possibilities for accountability and promote innovative thinking Increased transparency also facilitates active involvement and public participation and may limit the scope for corruption and misuse of resources The commitment will mainly be achieved through strengthening channels for dialogue and feedback on aid management and implementation with different parts of society br br Main activities br br Develop and implement an updated government strategy for aid information and communication activities br br 11 br br Negotiate and implement a compact between the Government and Swedish civil society organisations that enhances dialogue and outlines these organisations role in Swedish aid br br Support initiatives related to ICT that create opportunities for increased participation from a broader spectrum of the population br br Further develop procedures for management of reports by the public organisations br br and employees of misuse suspected corruption and other complaints with an impact on Swedish aid funds

Commitment title: Commitment 3 Increased access to Swedish aid information
Full commitment text: The commitment on increased access to Swedish aid information aims to increase the transparency of aid spending and performance Transparent information is a prerequisite for open debate and public participation and facilitates accountability to citizens and organisations in partner countries and to Swedish taxpayers More accessible information also provides a better basis for decisions and visibility of aid results and limits the scope for corruption and misuse of resources The commitment will be achieved mainly through further development of the Openaid se platform Improved IATI reporting will also br br result in improvements in Openaid se br br Main activities br br Follow up the implementation of the transparency guarantee in Swedish aid in order to ensure that relevant routines are in place br br Update Sweden s Common Standard implementation schedule in order to further extend and broaden Sweden s IATI reporting br br Further develop the Openaid se platform in order to extend and improve data quality accessibility and usability br br The activities will mainly be performed by the Ministry for Foreign Affairs and the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency Sida based on several existing assignments and related working plans In addition the implementation of the Swedish br br aid transparency guarantee applies to all public actors who have been allocated development assistance funds Dialogue with civil society e g regular meetings contacts and follow up will be carried out within each activity For example the Openaid se platform maintains an open channel for communication and feedback from users The activities will be implemented during the whole Action Plan time frame focusing on the December 2015 deadline for full implementation of the Common Standard

Commitment title: Commitment 2 A step further on the re use of public administration documents
Full commitment text: The commitment on a step further on the re use of public administration documents aims to enhance economic growth greater openness and better service for citizens Various estimates point to considerable value for society when the re use of public administration documents is increased When information from the public sector is being re used compiled processed and made available the ability of citizens to gain insight and make demands on government activities increases A more open government can increase its legitimacy among citizens and their willingness to participate in the development of the service level efficiency and quality of public services The commitment will mainly be achieved through changes in Swedish legislation proposed by a Government Inquiry and actions to promote and monitor the re use of public administration documents br br Main activities br br Prepare for changes in the Act on the re use of public administration documents 2010 566 in order to implement the Directive 2013 37 EU Public Sector Information Directive 7 br br Support initiatives related to the project Application profile for data portals in br br Europe DCAT AP where Sweden participates 8 br br Continue to facilitate actions in order to promote agencies re use of public administration documents at different levels br br Improve comprehensive follow up and monitoring including continuing to systematically give missions to agencies to report on their work on re using public administration documents br br

Commitment title: Commitment 1 Putting citizens at the centre eGovernment of government administration reforms
Full commitment text: The commitment on putting citizens at the centre eGovernment aims to make everyday br br life easier open up administration in order to support innovation and participation and increase operational quality and effectiveness as stated in the eGovernment strategy br br Putting the citizen at the centre The strategy has three objectives br br simplicity in order to develop easy and user friendly solutions br br transparency and innovation in order to take advantage of digital opportunities to increase transparency strengthen democracy and contribute to increased economic growth through open data and br br increased efficiency through digitisation br br Transparency and openness are crucial to democratic accountability Therefore transparency and access to information about government administration are vital Supplying public sector information and digital services in standardised formats allows businesses and organisations to re use it and to develop their own services These services can supplement the range of services delivered by government agencies and meet diverse civic needs The commitment will mainly be achieved through continuing the implementation of the eGovernment strategy Putting the citizen at the centre including strengthening the governance of the digitisation efforts of the government administration br br Main activities br br Develop a multi annual reform programme to be presented in Budget bill for 2015 called the Digital move in order to achieve the objectives of the Putting the citizen at the centre strategy as well as support other public digitisation efforts br br Appoint an inquiry to investigate how an improved governance of public digital information can improve the efficiency transparency and innovation in the public sector as a part of the eGovernment reform programme br br Promote the use of open data and agencies to release more data br br Promote and coordinate

Commitment title: 1 Continuing the development of the Openaid se platform
Full commitment text: By continuously developing the Openaid se platform transparency and openness will increase and facilitate accountability to Swedish taxpayers and people in our partner countries Continued development will include i further quality assurance ii monthly updated information from all public actors allocated funds under the international development cooperation expenditure area iii an expanded range of published documents explaining when to whom and why money has been made available iv enhanced visibility of the aid chain activity structure displaying the linking between e g a policy decision and a disbursement v a spotlight on results and evaluations vi enhanced use of the open format Application Programming Interface API which enables consumers to reuse the data vii data from CSOs and viii a focus on Sida s recently developed whistleblower function Those who use the data are able to contribute to the development of the platform by proposing improvements through the customer service function on the website

Commitment title: 2 Ensuring full implementation of the IATI standard by 2015
Full commitment text: To further broaden Sweden s implementation measures will be taken to extend and improve the data conduct investigations of the efforts needed to report on some of IATI s optional components including publishing information on results conditions activity level budgets and future flows and all documents in machine readable and accessible format and improve the coverage of planned disbursements Improvements to the data contained in Openaid se will result in improved IATI reporting and vice versa Through consultations and dialogue with CSOs Sweden continuously receives input to the process and reviews how to publish more data in response to feedback from CSOs and to move closer to complete fulfilment of the IATI standard

Commitment title: 3 Implementing the commitments in the Busan Partnership document
Full commitment text: Implementing the commitments in the Busan Partnership document includes contributing to the agreement on a common open standard for the electronic publication of aid information by December 2015 making the full range of information publicly available focusing on transparent public financial management and aid information management systems and making development cooperation more predictable A common standard is essential to enable access to information about aid flows and activities in both donor countries and partner countries a common global standard can enforce transparency throughout the chain of aid information and provide timely comparable detailed and accessible data

Commitment title: 4 Playing a leading role in the Building Block on Transparency
Full commitment text: Sweden will continue to act as a driving force to secure implementation of the Building Block on Transparency through its role as co chair We will support ongoing multi stakeholder partnerships on accountability predictability and transparency and different actors work on effectiveness results and transparency Further it will be done by ensuring involvement of a wide range of actors including donors partner countries multilateral organisations civil society and the private sector We will ensure that work is carried out in a coordinated and effective manner to ensure the transparency agenda is taken forward the best way possible to accomplish steady progress A comprehensive approach to existing initiatives is essential Sweden will promote the inclusion of comprehensiveness in the work of the Building Block

Commitment title: 5 Contributing to further define the work towards an EU Transparency Guarantee
Full commitment text: This will be done by working towards the establishment of an appropriate forum for EU Member State and European Commission transparency specialists to hold technical discussions and share information and that EU MS work towards a clear and common goal for increased transparency and accountability Further Sweden will contribute to the process by sharing its experiences of implementing a national transparency initiative ensuring leverage from its role as one of the key actors in the ongoing international discussions on how to deliver on the Busan commitments Where appropriate Sweden should also promote dialogue on technical issues with non EU entities involved in transparency with a view to fostering informed EU discussions

Commitment title: 6 Engaging in the Open Aid Partnership and promoting ICT4D
Full commitment text: Innovative technologies such as geocoding aid activities is a powerful way to show what donors are doing and where and therefore also helpful in increasing transparency and in the debate on the division of labour Recognising the significant impact that these innovations can have on improving development effectiveness the World Bank Institute and bilateral donor partners foundations and civil society have formed an Open Aid Partnership Further support to initiatives related to open data and information and communication technology ICT that create opportunities for increased participation from a broader spectrum of the population Exploring and investing in ICT is key for enhanced accountability increased openness and transparency worldwide The Swedish agenda for ICT in development cooperation includes Information and Communication Technology for Development ICT4D with the purpose of contributing to improved prospects for poverty reduction Business for Development accountability increased democratic participation inclusive economic growth freedom of expression and knowledge development ICT for enhanced accountability and eGovernment

Commitment title: 7 Broadening open government commitments
Full commitment text: Sweden intends to broaden its OGP commitments in the ongoing process of defining the next generation strategy for open and smart government The upcoming strategy will broaden the initial focus on effectively managing public resources in development cooperation to include the government as a whole The upcoming strategy will thus provide a coherent policy framework for a smart and open government supporting innovation and participation Under the current timeframe the strategy will be launched in autumn 2012

Commitment title: 3 1 To enact a Freedom of Information Act by December 2014
Full commitment text: The legislation will be established in line with international best practice and shall include br br i Recognition of a human right to information along with a broad presumption of openness of information held by public bodies including state owned enterprises and bodies and private bodies undertaking public functions or operating under public funding br br ii An obligation to publish a wide range of information on a proactive basis br br iii Robust procedures for making and processing requests which are simple free and quick with a clearly specified maximum response time br br iv A limited regime of exceptions based on preventing harm to protected and security related interests a public interest override and severability where part of a record is exempt br br v A right of appeal br br vi Protection for good faith disclosures and sanctions for obstruction of access and br br vii Obligations to report on requests received backed up by sanctions for refusal to disclose information without reasonable cause

Commitment title: 3 2 To establish an open data system by December 2016
Full commitment text: Key steps to operationalizing this commitment include the following br br i Establishing a coordinating body or working group under the Ministry of Finance for exploration of this issue br br ii Supporting guidelines issued followed by legislative resolutions demonstrating support for transparent operations and the integration of open data into policy considerations including provision of data in machine readable formats br br iii Establishment of a user friendly interactive open data portal data go tz br br iv Publication of key datasets on data go tz particularly related to the education health and water sectors including data from Basic Education Statistics in Tanzania BEST and national examinations NECTA medical facilities and Medical Stores Department MSD water points company registrations NBS census and survey data and GIS data on village and ward boundaries and with all data an emphasis on provision of disaggregated data at the facility level so as to be meaningful to citizens

Commitment title: 3 3 To make budget data eight key budget reports audit committee reports and tax exemptions publicly available by December 2014
Full commitment text: In line with internationally accepted good practices for open budgets this includes br br i Publish in a timely manner the following eight key budget reports each budget year a pre budget statement the executive s budget proposal the enacted budget a citizens budget in year reports on revenues collected expenditures made and debt incurred a mid year review a year end report and audit reports br br ii Publish the reports of the Parliamentary Audit Committees br br iii Publish all tax exemptions on a monthly basis br br iv Publish Budget data online in machine readable formats as well as key information made available at district councils as far as possible at all education and health facilities

Commitment title: 3 4 Make land use plan ownership and demarcated areas for large scale land deals accessible online for public use by June 2016
Full commitment text: This includes br br i Publish demarcated areas for large scale agricultural investment farming and livestock keeping br br ii Publish all land use plans and make it accessible both at national and local levels br br iii Make easily searchable land ownership database online

Commitment title: 3 5 Tanzania to fulfill its EITI commitments by June 2015
Full commitment text: This include br br i Publish signed MDA contracts from 2014 onwards by June 2015 br br ii Document Governments policy on actual practice for disclosure of contracts signed before 2014 by June 2015 br br iii Publish Demarcated areas for Mining by December 2014

Commitment title: i Citizens website
Full commitment text: Improve Citizens Website www wananchi go tz to make it more robust and responsive as a platform for citizens to participate in the running of Government and produce monthly reports on effectiveness of the citizens website

Commitment title: i Dashboard of OGP progress
Full commitment text: Provide overall dashboard of progress on implementation of Tanzania OGP commitments and ensure that reports are provided in quarterly basis

Commitment title: i National Audit Office website
Full commitment text: Improve National Audit Office Controller and Auditor General s website to make it more open and user friendly and provide data in machine readable format

Commitment title: i Water data and mapping
Full commitment text: Finalize Water Point Mapping System for local government authorities LGAs and make the disaggregated data available online and other means of communication

Commitment title: ii Access to health education and water data
Full commitment text: Strengthen the use of sectoral Management Information Systems health education water by making disaggregated data available online in machine readable format

Commitment title: ii Client service charters
Full commitment text: Develop and or review Clients Service Charters of Health Education and Water sectors for both national and facility level services and make them accessible to citizens

Commitment title: ii Participation by email and mobile phones
Full commitment text: Ensure wider participation of the citizens in the running of Government by establishing a platform for citizens to be able to send comments by mobile phone emails and other means and receive feedback within reasonable time

Commitment title: ii Reporting on medical supply orders
Full commitment text: Posting orders and receipts of medical supplies from the Medical Stores Department MSD online and on notice boards to the facility level and updated in real time

Commitment title: iii Citizens How Do I website
Full commitment text: Explore the feasibility of establishing a Nifanyeje a website where citizens can get practical information of how to go about getting Government services e g getting a scholarship for university water or electricity services drivers license business license passport and other services and what to do if they are unable to secure the service in the required time

Commitment title: iii Complaints register
Full commitment text: Review existing complaints register to ensure that complaints received are attended and feedback on action taken is adequately documented and posted to the prioritized sectors website quarterly

Commitment title: iii Government websites
Full commitment text: Strengthen ministerial and other Government institutions websites to post online within one month all reports studies data circulars and other public interest data in machine readable format except those which compromise national security

Commitment title: iii Open forum on OGP commitments
Full commitment text: Establish an open forum in collaboration with civil society to review quality integrity depth and pace of progress against OGP commitments

Commitment title: iv Citizens budget document
Full commitment text: Produce annual citizens budget document in a simplified language both in Kiswahili and English and in a format that will make it easy for ordinary citizen to understand

Commitment title: iv Contact point for OGP communication
Full commitment text: Establish a clear and reliable contact point and address for OGP communication within the Government

Commitment title: iv Global practice on data disclosure
Full commitment text: Study global good practice on data disclosure for establishment of www data go tz website that reflects high global standards to contain a substantial number of Government held data sets

Commitment title: iv Local government service boards and committees
Full commitment text: Strengthen existing LGAs Service Boards and Committees in order to make them serve citizens more effectively

Commitment title: ix Donor funding
Full commitment text: Encourage donors to exercise greater transparency of donor funding given to Tanzania Government Civil Society and Private Sector consistent with International Aid Transparency Initiative principles Likewise Government Civil Society and Private Sectors should post online revenues and expenditures in machine readable format on an annual basis

Commitment title: v Allocation of grants to local governments
Full commitment text: Review formula based grant allocation system to suit current needs of local government authorities LGAs and publish all LGAs allocations online

Commitment title: v Disclosure of public officials assets
Full commitment text: Prepare legislative amendments and regulations to strengthen asset disclosures of public officials

Commitment title: v Open government innovation by local entrepreneurs
Full commitment text: Foster communities of local ICT entrepreneurs and actors to spur greater innovation transparency and citizen engagement

Commitment title: vi Budget execution reports
Full commitment text: Post quarterly disbursements and execution reports on Ministry of Finance MoF website in machine readable format updated in real time

Commitment title: vii Local government transparency
Full commitment text: Ensure local government authorities LGAs abide to the existing requirements of posting approved budgets disbursements and execution reports on the boards and public places capitation grants development grants LGAs own revenue

Commitment title: viii Reports on tax exemptions
Full commitment text: Publish quarterly all Tax Exemptions granted in Health Education and Water related sectors on the Ministry of Finance website in machine readable format

Commitment title: x Best practices for Freedom of Information laws
Full commitment text: Study global best practice of freedom of information laws in order to generate inputs for preparation of a potential freedom of information Bill

Commitment title: xi Parastatal organisations
Full commitment text: Publishing of Parastatal Organisations Executive Agencies and Regulatory Authorities revenues and expenditure on websites and news papers

Commitment title: 1 1 To certify public agencies service quality
Full commitment text: To ensure that 40 percent of Public Service Agencies have attained the Trinidad and Tobago Diamond Standard Certification TTDS namely Health Education Transportation National Security Works and Infrastructure and Trade service agencies

Commitment title: 1 2 To develop Human Resources Management capacity in the public service
Full commitment text: To develop a strategic planning document a Change Management Plan and an ICT Plan in 4 public agencies and to develop a Competency Framework policy and system

Commitment title: 1 3 To conduct a Pilot project for the development and introduction of a Easier Life for Citizens Index
Full commitment text: To develop a rigourous tool to assess the quality of public services delivered to citizens that can be measured tracked and compared across Latin American and Caribbean countries

Commitment title: 1 4 To develop interactive media on Government business processes and programs to better access Government services
Full commitment text: To develop interactive media on Government business processes and programs in order to better inform the public of the services available requirements and process to access them A total of 50 Public Services Agencies will participate in this exercise particularly those that citizens do business with on a regular basis such as Passport services Licensing services Registration of births and deaths to name just a few

Commitment title: 1 5 To establish a Contact Centre to address the needs of national scholars local and international of Trinidad and Tobago
Full commitment text: Provide a virtual call centre for delivery of services to national scholars and their associates

Commitment title: 2 1 To adopt a policy on data standards and classification frameworks
Full commitment text: To adopt as a matter of Government policy data standards and classification frameworks through a multistakeholder consultative process

Commitment title: 2 2 To increase the number of publicly accessible Government datasets in open formats
Full commitment text: To conduct an Open Data Readiness Assessment with a view to releasing at least six data sets in a machine readable format

Commitment title: 2 4 To create an easily accessible open Government portal with a platform repository for open data as well as an interface to allow for feedback from the public
Full commitment text: To create an easily accessible open Government portal with a platform repository for open data as well as an interface aimed at allowing for feedback from the public

Commitment title: 3 1 To create a Civil Society Board
Full commitment text: To establish a mechanism that allows adequate representation of Civil Society organisations in order to provide feedback to public policy decision making on a regular basis

Commitment title: 4 1 To audit the Accounts of the Ministry of Energy and Energy Affairs to International Standards
Full commitment text: To ensure by 2015 that the accounts of the Ministry of Energy and Energy Affairs are audited to international standards

Commitment title: 4 2 To make publicly available the cadastre of licenses and contracts for the exploration and production of oil and gas in Trinidad and Tobago
Full commitment text: To make publicly available via the website of the Ministry of Energy and Energy Affairs the cadastre of licences and contracts for exploration and production of oil and gas resources in Trinidad and Tobago

Commitment title: 4 3 To include the mineral sector starting with National Quarries Company Ltd in the TTEITI Reporting Mechanism
Full commitment text: To include the National Quarries Company Ltd into the TTEITI reporting process by 2015 to cover fiscal period 2013 2014
